trans-unit.source: Create Hadoop, HBase, Storm, or Spark clusters on Linux in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create Hadoop, HBase, Storm, or Spark clusters on Linux in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create Hadoop, HBase, Storm, or Spark clusters on Linux for HDInsight using a browser, the Azure CLI, Azure PowerShell, REST, or through an SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create Hadoop, HBase, Storm, or Spark clusters on Linux for HDInsight using a browser, the Azure CLI, Azure PowerShell, REST, or through an SDK.

trans-unit.source: Create Linux-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Create Linux-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: In this document, you will learn about the different ways to create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster on Azure, as well as optional configurations that can be used with your cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you will learn about the different ways to create a Linux-based HDInsight cluster on Azure, as well as optional configurations that can be used with your cluster.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight provides Apache Hadoop, Apache Storm, and Apache HBase as services on the Azure cloud platform.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight provides Apache Hadoop, Apache Storm, and Apache HBase as services on the Azure cloud platform.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This document provides instructions on the different ways to create a cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This document provides instructions on the different ways to create a cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you are looking for a quick-start approach to create a cluster, see [Get Started with Azure HDInsight on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: If you are looking for a quick-start approach to create a cluster, see [Get Started with Azure HDInsight on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: What is an HDInsight cluster?
trans-unit.target: What is an HDInsight cluster?

trans-unit.source: A Hadoop cluster consists of several virtual machines (nodes,) which are used for distributed processing of tasks on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: A Hadoop cluster consists of several virtual machines (nodes,) which are used for distributed processing of tasks on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Azure abstracts the implementation details of installation and configuration of individual nodes, so you only have to provide general configuration information.
trans-unit.target: Azure abstracts the implementation details of installation and configuration of individual nodes, so you only have to provide general configuration information.

trans-unit.source: Cluster types
trans-unit.target: Cluster types

trans-unit.source: There are several types of HDInsight available:
trans-unit.target: There are several types of HDInsight available:

trans-unit.source: Cluster type
trans-unit.target: Cluster type

trans-unit.source: Use this if you need...
trans-unit.target: Use this if you need...

trans-unit.source: Hadoop
trans-unit.target: Hadoop

trans-unit.source: query and analysis (batch jobs)
trans-unit.target: query and analysis (batch jobs)

trans-unit.source: HBase
trans-unit.target: HBase

trans-unit.source: NoSQL data storage
trans-unit.target: NoSQL data storage

trans-unit.source: Storm
trans-unit.target: Storm

trans-unit.source: Real-time event processing
trans-unit.target: Real-time event processing

trans-unit.source: Spark (Preview)
trans-unit.target: Spark (Preview)

trans-unit.source: In-memory processing, interactive queries, micro-batch stream processing
trans-unit.target: In-memory processing, interactive queries, micro-batch stream processing

trans-unit.source: During configuration, you will select one of these types for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: During configuration, you will select one of these types for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can add other technologies such as Hue or R to these basic types by using [Script Actions](#scriptaction).
trans-unit.target: You can add other technologies such as Hue or R to these basic types by using [Script Actions](#scriptaction).

trans-unit.source: Each cluster type has its own terminology for nodes within the cluster, as well as the number of nodes and the default VM size for each node type:
trans-unit.target: Each cluster type has its own terminology for nodes within the cluster, as well as the number of nodes and the default VM size for each node type:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB ram.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB ram.

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Hadoop.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Hadoop cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Hadoop.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight have two types nodes:
trans-unit.target: Hadoop clusters for HDInsight have two types nodes:

trans-unit.source: Head node (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head node (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Data node (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Data node (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight HBase cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.HBase.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight HBase cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.HBase.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: HBase clusters for HDInsight have three types of nodes:
trans-unit.target: HBase clusters for HDInsight have three types of nodes:

trans-unit.source: Head servers (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head servers (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Region servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Region servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Master/Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Storm cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Storm.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Storm cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Storm.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: Storm clusters for HDInsight have three types nodes:
trans-unit.target: Storm clusters for HDInsight have three types nodes:

trans-unit.source: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Nimbus nodes (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Supervisor servers (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes)

trans-unit.source: ![HDInsight Spark cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Spark.roles.png)
trans-unit.target: ![HDInsight Spark cluster nodes](./media/hdinsight-provision-clusters/HDInsight.Spark.roles.png)

trans-unit.source: Spark clusters for HDInsight have three types of nodes:
trans-unit.target: Spark clusters for HDInsight have three types of nodes:

trans-unit.source: Head node (2 nodes)
trans-unit.target: Head node (2 nodes)

trans-unit.source: Worker node (at least 1 node)
trans-unit.target: Worker node (at least 1 node)

trans-unit.source: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes) (Free for A1 Zookeepers VM size)
trans-unit.target: Zookeeper nodes (3 nodes) (Free for A1 Zookeepers VM size)

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage for HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage for HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Each cluster type will also have one or more Azure Storage accounts associated with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Each cluster type will also have one or more Azure Storage accounts associated with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses Azure blobs from these storage accounts as the data store for your cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses Azure blobs from these storage accounts as the data store for your cluster.

trans-unit.source: Keeping the data separate from the cluster allows you to delete clusters when they aren't in use, and still preserve your data.
trans-unit.target: Keeping the data separate from the cluster allows you to delete clusters when they aren't in use, and still preserve your data.

trans-unit.source: You can then use the same storage account for a new cluster if you need to do more analysis.
trans-unit.target: You can then use the same storage account for a new cluster if you need to do more analysis.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: Basic configuration options
trans-unit.target: Basic configuration options

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe the required configuration options available when creating an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe the required configuration options available when creating an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Cluster name
trans-unit.target: Cluster name

trans-unit.source: The cluster name provides a unique identifier for the cluster, and is used as part of the domain name for accessing the cluster over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: The cluster name provides a unique identifier for the cluster, and is used as part of the domain name for accessing the cluster over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: For example, a cluster named _mycluster_ will be available over the internet as _mycluster_.azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, a cluster named _mycluster_ will be available over the internet as _mycluster_.azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: The cluster name must follow the following guidelines:
trans-unit.target: The cluster name must follow the following guidelines:

trans-unit.source: The field must contain a string that is between 3 and 63 characters
trans-unit.target: The field must contain a string that is between 3 and 63 characters

trans-unit.source: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens
trans-unit.target: The field can contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens

trans-unit.source: Cluster type
trans-unit.target: Cluster type

trans-unit.source: Cluster type allows you to select special purpose configurations for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Cluster type allows you to select special purpose configurations for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following are the types available for Linux-based HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: The following are the types available for Linux-based HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: Cluster type
trans-unit.target: Cluster type

trans-unit.source: Use this if you need...
trans-unit.target: Use this if you need...

trans-unit.source: Hadoop
trans-unit.target: Hadoop

trans-unit.source: query and analysis (batch jobs)
trans-unit.target: query and analysis (batch jobs)

trans-unit.source: HBase
trans-unit.target: HBase

trans-unit.source: NoSQL data storage
trans-unit.target: NoSQL data storage

trans-unit.source: Storm
trans-unit.target: Storm

trans-unit.source: Real-time event processing
trans-unit.target: Real-time event processing

trans-unit.source: Spark (Preview)
trans-unit.target: Spark (Preview)

trans-unit.source: In-memory processing, interactive queries, micro-batch stream processing
trans-unit.target: In-memory processing, interactive queries, micro-batch stream processing

trans-unit.source: You can add other technologies such as Hue or R to these basic types by using [Script Actions](#scriptaction).
trans-unit.target: You can add other technologies such as Hue or R to these basic types by using [Script Actions](#scriptaction).

trans-unit.source: Cluster operating system
trans-unit.target: Cluster operating system

trans-unit.source: You can provision HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:
trans-unit.target: You can provision HDInsight clusters on one of the following two operating systems:

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**: Select this option if you need to integrate with Windows-based services and technologies that will run on the cluster with Hadoop, or if you are migrating from an existing Windows-based Hadoop distribution.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Windows (Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter)**: Select this option if you need to integrate with Windows-based services and technologies that will run on the cluster with Hadoop, or if you are migrating from an existing Windows-based Hadoop distribution.

trans-unit.source: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux)**: Select this option if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.
trans-unit.target: **HDInsight on Linux (Ubuntu 12.04 LTS for Linux)**: Select this option if you are familiar with Linux or Unix, migrating from an existing Linux-based Hadoop solution, or want easy integration with Hadoop ecosystem components built for Linux.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get started with Hadoop on Linux in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Information in this document assumes that you are using a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Information in this document assumes that you are using a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information that is specific to Windows-based clusters, see [Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For information that is specific to Windows-based clusters, see [Create Windows-based Hadoop clusters in HDInsight](hdinsight-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: Subscription name
trans-unit.target: Subscription name

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use this to select the one you want to use when creating the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use this to select the one you want to use when creating the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Resource group
trans-unit.target: Resource group

trans-unit.source: Applications are typically made up of many components, for example a web app, database, database server, storage, and 3rd party services.
trans-unit.target: Applications are typically made up of many components, for example a web app, database, database server, storage, and 3rd party services.

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group, referred to as an Azure Resource Group.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) enables you to work with the resources in your application as a group, referred to as an Azure Resource Group.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy, update, monitor or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy, update, monitor or delete all of the resources for your application in a single, coordinated operation.

trans-unit.source: You use a template for deployment and that template can work for different environments such as testing, staging and production.
trans-unit.target: You use a template for deployment and that template can work for different environments such as testing, staging and production.

trans-unit.source: You can clarify billing for your organization by viewing the rolled-up costs for the entire group.
trans-unit.target: You can clarify billing for your organization by viewing the rolled-up costs for the entire group.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](../resource-group-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](../resource-group-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: Credentials
trans-unit.target: Credentials

trans-unit.source: There are two types of authentication used with HDInsight clusters:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of authentication used with HDInsight clusters:

trans-unit.source: __Admin__ or __HTTPs__ user: The admin account for a cluster is primarily used when accessing web or REST services exposed by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: __Admin__ or __HTTPs__ user: The admin account for a cluster is primarily used when accessing web or REST services exposed by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: It cannot be used to directly login to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: It cannot be used to directly login to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: __SSH username__: An SSH user account is used to remotely access the cluster using a [Secure Shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Shell) client.
trans-unit.target: __SSH username__: An SSH user account is used to remotely access the cluster using a [Secure Shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_Shell) client.

trans-unit.source: This is most often used to provide a remote command-line access to the cluster head nodes.
trans-unit.target: This is most often used to provide a remote command-line access to the cluster head nodes.

trans-unit.source: The admin account is secured by a password, and all web communications to the cluster using the admin account should be performed over a secure HTTPS connection.
trans-unit.target: The admin account is secured by a password, and all web communications to the cluster using the admin account should be performed over a secure HTTPS connection.

trans-unit.source: The SSH user can be authenticated using either a password or a certificate.
trans-unit.target: The SSH user can be authenticated using either a password or a certificate.

trans-unit.source: Certificate authentication is the most secure option, however it requires the creation and maintenance of a public and private certificate pair.
trans-unit.target: Certificate authentication is the most secure option, however it requires the creation and maintenance of a public and private certificate pair.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, including how to create and use SSH keys, see one of the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, including how to create and use SSH keys, see one of the following articles:

trans-unit.source: [For Linux, Unix, or Mac OS X clients - using SSH with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: [For Linux, Unix, or Mac OS X clients - using SSH with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: [For Windows clients - using SSH with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)
trans-unit.target: [For Windows clients - using SSH with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)

trans-unit.source: Data source
trans-unit.target: Data source

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses Azure Blob Storage as the underlying storage for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses Azure Blob Storage as the underlying storage for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Internally, Hadoop and other software on the cluster sees this storage as a Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) compatible system.
trans-unit.target: Internally, Hadoop and other software on the cluster sees this storage as a Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) compatible system.

trans-unit.source: When creating a new cluster, you must either create a new Azure Storage Account, or use an existing one.
trans-unit.target: When creating a new cluster, you must either create a new Azure Storage Account, or use an existing one.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The geographic location you select for the storage account will determine the location of the HDInsight cluster, as the cluster must be in the same data center as the default storage account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] The geographic location you select for the storage account will determine the location of the HDInsight cluster, as the cluster must be in the same data center as the default storage account.

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported regions, click the **Region** drop-down list on [HDInsight pricing](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=282635&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: Default storage container
trans-unit.target: Default storage container

trans-unit.source: HDInsight will also create a _default storage container_ on the storage account.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight will also create a _default storage container_ on the storage account.

trans-unit.source: This is the default storage for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This is the default storage for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, this container has the same name as the cluster.
trans-unit.target: By default, this container has the same name as the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how HDInsight works with Azure Blob Storage, see [Use HDFS-compatible Azure Blob storage with Hadoop in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on how HDInsight works with Azure Blob Storage, see [Use HDFS-compatible Azure Blob storage with Hadoop in HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Don't share one container for multiple clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Don't share one container for multiple clusters.

trans-unit.source: This is not supported.
trans-unit.target: This is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Node size
trans-unit.target: Node size

trans-unit.source: You can select the size of compute resources used by the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can select the size of compute resources used by the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you know that you will be performing operations that need a lot of memory, you may want to select a compute resource with more memory.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you know that you will be performing operations that need a lot of memory, you may want to select a compute resource with more memory.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The nodes used by your cluster do not count as Virtual Machines, as the Virtual Machines images used for the nodes are an implementation detail of the HDInsight service; however, the compute cores used by the nodes do count against the total number of compute cores available to your subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The nodes used by your cluster do not count as Virtual Machines, as the Virtual Machines images used for the nodes are an implementation detail of the HDInsight service; however, the compute cores used by the nodes do count against the total number of compute cores available to your subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can see the number of cores that will be used by the cluster, as well as the number of cores available, in the summary section of the Node Pricing Tiers blade when creating an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can see the number of cores that will be used by the cluster, as well as the number of cores available, in the summary section of the Node Pricing Tiers blade when creating an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Different cluster types have different node types, number of nodes, and node sizes.
trans-unit.target: Different cluster types have different node types, number of nodes, and node sizes.

trans-unit.source: For example, a Hadoop cluster type has two _head nodes_ and a default of four _data nodes_, while a Storm cluster type has two _nimbus nodes_, three _zookeeper nodes_, and a default of four _supervisor nodes_.
trans-unit.target: For example, a Hadoop cluster type has two _head nodes_ and a default of four _data nodes_, while a Storm cluster type has two _nimbus nodes_, three _zookeeper nodes_, and a default of four _supervisor nodes_.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB RAM.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] If you plan on more than 32 worker nodes, either at cluster creation or by scaling the cluster after creation, then you must select a head node size with at least 8 cores and 14GB RAM.

trans-unit.source: When using the Azure preview portal to configure the cluster, the Node size is available through the __Node Pricing Tier__ blade, and will also display the cost associated with the different node sizes.
trans-unit.target: When using the Azure preview portal to configure the cluster, the Node size is available through the __Node Pricing Tier__ blade, and will also display the cost associated with the different node sizes.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Billing starts once a cluster is created, and only stops when the cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Billing starts once a cluster is created, and only stops when the cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For more information on pricing, see [HDInsight pricing details](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: For more information on pricing, see [HDInsight pricing details](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: Optional configuration
trans-unit.target: Optional configuration

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe optional configuration options, as well as scenarios that would require these configurations.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe optional configuration options, as well as scenarios that would require these configurations.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight version
trans-unit.target: HDInsight version

trans-unit.source: Use this to determine the version of HDInsight used for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Use this to determine the version of HDInsight used for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Hadoop cluster versions and components in HDInsight](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/?LinkID=320896&clcid=0x409)

trans-unit.source: Use Azure virtual networks
trans-unit.target: Use Azure virtual networks

trans-unit.source: An [Azure Virtual Network](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.
trans-unit.target: An [Azure Virtual Network](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/services/virtual-network/) allows you to create a secure, persistent network containing the resources you need for your solution.

trans-unit.source: A virtual network allows you to:
trans-unit.target: A virtual network allows you to:

trans-unit.source: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).
trans-unit.target: Connect cloud resources together in a private network (cloud-only).

trans-unit.source: ![diagram of cloud-only configuration](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-cloud-only.png)
trans-unit.target: ![diagram of cloud-only configuration](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-cloud-only.png)

trans-unit.source: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).
trans-unit.target: Connect your cloud resources to your local data-center network (site-to-site or point-to-site) by using a virtual private network (VPN).

trans-unit.source: Site-to-site configuration
trans-unit.target: Site-to-site configuration

trans-unit.source: Point-to-site configuration
trans-unit.target: Point-to-site configuration

trans-unit.source:
Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.
![diagram of site-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-site-to-site.png)
trans-unit.target:
Site-to-site configuration allows you to connect multiple resources from your data center to the Azure virtual network by using a hardware VPN or the Routing and Remote Access Service.
![diagram of site-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-site-to-site.png)

trans-unit.source:
Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.
![diagram of point-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-point-to-site.png)
trans-unit.target:
Point-to-site configuration allows you to connect a specific resource to the Azure virtual network by using a software VPN.
![diagram of point-to-site configuration](./media/hdinsight-hadoop-provision-linux-clusters/hdinsight-vnet-point-to-site.png)

trans-unit.source: For more information on using HDInsight with a Virtual Network, including specific configuration requirements for the Virtual Network, see [Extend HDInsight capbilities by using an Azure Virtual Network](hdinsight-extend-hadoop-virtual-network.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using HDInsight with a Virtual Network, including specific configuration requirements for the Virtual Network, see [Extend HDInsight capbilities by using an Azure Virtual Network](hdinsight-extend-hadoop-virtual-network.md).

trans-unit.source: Metastore
trans-unit.target: Metastore

trans-unit.source: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as information about Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.
trans-unit.target: The metastore contains Hive and Oozie metadata, such as information about Hive tables, partitions, schemas, and columns.

trans-unit.source: Using the metastore helps you retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't have to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you create a new cluster.
trans-unit.target: Using the metastore helps you retain your Hive and Oozie metadata, so that you don't have to re-create Hive tables or Oozie jobs when you create a new cluster.

trans-unit.source: Using the Metastore configuration option allows you to specify an external metastore using SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Using the Metastore configuration option allows you to specify an external metastore using SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This allows the metadata information to be preserved when you delete a cluster, as it is stored externally in the database.
trans-unit.target: This allows the metadata information to be preserved when you delete a cluster, as it is stored externally in the database.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to create a SQL database in Azure, see [Create your first Azure SQL Database](../sql-database/sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to create a SQL database in Azure, see [Create your first Azure SQL Database](../sql-database/sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Metastore configuration is not available for HBase cluster types.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Metastore configuration is not available for HBase cluster types.

trans-unit.source: Script action
trans-unit.target: Script action

trans-unit.source: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during cluster provisioning.
trans-unit.target: You can install additional components or customize cluster configuration by using scripts during cluster provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**.
trans-unit.target: Such scripts are invoked via **Script Action**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize HDInsight cluster using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Adding additional components after a cluster has been created is not supported, as these components will not be available after a cluster node is reimaged.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Adding additional components after a cluster has been created is not supported, as these components will not be available after a cluster node is reimaged.

trans-unit.source: Components installed through script actions are reinstalled as part of the reimaging process.
trans-unit.target: Components installed through script actions are reinstalled as part of the reimaging process.

trans-unit.source: Additional storage
trans-unit.target: Additional storage

trans-unit.source: In some cases, you may wish to add additional storage to the cluster.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, you may wish to add additional storage to the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have multiple Azure Storage Accounts for different geographical regions, or for different services, but want to analyze them all with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have multiple Azure Storage Accounts for different geographical regions, or for different services, but want to analyze them all with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using secondary blob stores, see [Using Azure Blob storage with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using secondary blob stores, see [Using Azure Blob storage with HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-use-blob-storage.md).
